DOC.brief_title: Moyamoya Disease Biomarkers Patients With Intracranial Atherosclerotic Stroke
DOC.detailed_description: 1 . Purpose Both moyamoya disease ( MMD ) intracranial atherosclerotic stenosis ( ICAS ) prevalent Asians Westerners , although reason race-ethnic difference unsettle . It possible patient adult-onset MMD misclassified ICAS , may part explain high prevalence intracranial atherosclerosis Asians . It important differentiation two disease MMD ICAS differential therapeutic strategy ( surgical revascularization MMD vs. use antithrombotics/statins stenting ICAS ) . The ring finger 213 ( RNF213 ) recently identify susceptibility gene MMD East Asians . Characteristic high-resolution ( HR ) MRI finding MMD ICAS recently report . The aim study investigate proportion patient moyamoya disease among patient diagnose intracranial atherosclerotic stroke . To , biomarkers ( gene image ) moyamoya disease test follow angiography perform follow ( select patient ) . 2 . Conditions : Stroke , intracranial occlusive lesion 3 . Intervention : None 4 . Study period : Jan 22 , 2014 ~ Dec 31 , 2016 5 . Study design : Observational model Time perspective : Retrospective-Prospective
DOC.criteria: 1 . Intracranial atherosclerotic stroke Patients age 20 year Patients focal neurological deficit present within 7 day symptom onset Patients acute ischemic lesion diffusionweighted image ( DWI ) Patients stenosis relevant intracranial vessel ( distal ICA and/ M1 ) 2 . Moyamoya disease Patients age 20 year Patients perform conventional angiography Patients diagnose either definite probable Moyamoya disease 3 . Healthy subject Subjects age 20 year Subjects history cerebrovascular disease Patients extracranial stenosis 50 % Patients potential source cardioaortic embolism Patients moderate severe renal disease Pregnancy lactation Patients short life expectancy
